filament_augmentation.utils.timestamp_utilites module

filament_augmentation.utils.timestamp_utilites.find_closest(q_time: datetime.datetime, timestamp_dict: dict) → int[source]

finds the closest timestamp value for given q-time and return the index of timestamp dict. :param timestamp_dict: the dictionary of timestamps as keys and image ids as values. :param q_time: datetime for which the image id should be queried. :return: index of the closest timestamp Note: this code is based on the suggestions here:

  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8162379/python-locating-the-closest-timestamp

  • https://docs.python.org/2/library/datetime.html#strftime-and-strptime-behavior

filament_augmentation.utils.timestamp_utilites.get_timestamp_dict(bbso_json: dict) → dict[source]

Gets a sorted dictionary with all timestamp values in bbso json file as keys and image ids as values. :param bbso_json: BBSO json file as input :return: the timestamp and image ids dictonary
